summary: This is a March 16, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, producing discovery materials including manifests of items seized by the FBI in Florida and New York. The letter indicates the materials are governed by a protective order and are designated as confidential.

events.title: Discovery Production in Maxwell Case
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces discovery materials, including manifests of items seized by the FBI, to defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials including manifests of items seized by the FBI in Florida and New York in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The produced materials are stamped with control numbers SDNY_GM_02743101 through SDNY_GM_02743102 and are designated as confidential under a July 31, 2020 protective order.
The letter is signed by Assistant U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss and addressed to five defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document indicates the government's ongoing discovery obligations in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
